quest.name: All the Little Ladies (Limsa Lominsa)
journal:
The royal seneschal would see you enjoy the Little Ladies' Day festivities to the fullest.
※This quest is available for a limited time only.

As the royal seneschal tells it, a doll contest will be the focal point of this year's Little Ladies' Day. He urges you to participate, suggesting that you speak with Serendipity, mistress of the Goldsmiths' Guild in Ul'dah, about acquiring a doll for the contest.

※Please note that you will be unable to complete this quest after the seasonal event has ended. For details, please check the Lodestone.

As might be expected given the season, the Goldsmiths' Guild already struggles to meet a deluge of doll orders, and cannot accept any further commissions. All hope is not lost, however, as Serendipity appears to have one last trick up her sleeve. Should your heart be set on proving yourself the daintiest doll-dresser in the land, speak with her once more.
objectives: Speak with Serendipity at the Goldsmiths' Guild.

dialogue.name: BUTLER
dialogue.text: Good eveningmorningday to you, adventurer! I trust that you are enjoying yourself during this most wondrous of celebrations. I do believe this year's Little Ladies' Day will be the most splendrous festival to have graced the realm.

dialogue.name: BUTLER
dialogue.text: What is Little Ladies' Day, you ask? Why, it is a day when the gentlemen of Eorzea assume the role of seneschals, doting upon the needs of Eorzea's fair maidens who are as princesses for the day.

dialogue.name: BUTLER
dialogue.text: The tradition began some three centuries ago with Princess Edvya Thorne of Ul'dah. Mayhap you have heard the tale?

dialogue.name: BUTLER
dialogue.text: This year, I have the honor of being a royal seneschal, overseeing preparations for the festivities. I take this role quite seriously.

dialogue.name: BUTLER
dialogue.text: Manifold are the delights to revel in during this fair season, but that which captures my fancy most of all is this year's Princess Edvya doll contest.

dialogue.name: BUTLER
dialogue.text: Even as we speak, townsfolk the realm over are tailoring gowns for their dolls in the likeness of Princess Edvya. Once ready, the little ladies of each city–state will cast their votes to determine the fairest figurine of them all.

dialogue.name: BUTLER
dialogue.text: The victor shall be rewarded handsomely for herhis efforts, though I daresay the joy of dollcraft is its own reward. Would that I had time to participate, but there is ever so much to do! What say you give it a try? There is no better way to partake in the holiday spirit.

dialogue.name: BUTLER
dialogue.text: What? You lack the manual dexterity required to make a doll for the contest? I will hear no such nonsense!

dialogue.name: BUTLER
dialogue.text: Still, if you so doubt your aptitude for crafting, you might consider purchasing a doll for the contest. It is not unheard of for those who cannot create their own to use one.

dialogue.name: BUTLER
dialogue.text: The key to this contest is the doll's dressing, so at the very least, you will have a proper foundation for your entry. With a little effort, your own little princess might be judged the most charming in the realm!

dialogue.name: BUTLER
dialogue.text: Yes, hurry along and place an order with Serendipity at the Goldsmiths' Guild in Ul'dah. There is much to do if you wish to enter the contest in time.

dialogue.name: SERENDIPITY
dialogue.text: Greetings, and welcome to the Goldsmiths' Guild! People call me Mistress Serendipity, but you can call me Sera!

dialogue.name: SERENDIPITY
dialogue.text: What did you say your name was? Ah, Forename, that's right! What can I do for you today?

dialogue.name: SERENDIPITY
dialogue.text: Oh, Forename! I imagine you've been refining your skills since last we met. What can I do for you today?

dialogue.name: SERENDIPITY
dialogue.text: A Princess Edvya doll? Oh, dear...

dialogue.name: SERENDIPITY
dialogue.text: I would like nothing more than to help you─truly, I would─but we're absolutely swamped with commissions. Why, it would take a miracle just to fill the orders we already have!

dialogue.name: SERENDIPITY
dialogue.text: That said, I'd hate to see you miss out on the festivities.

dialogue.name: SERENDIPITY
dialogue.text: There simply must be a way to get you a doll for the contest.

dialogue.name: SERENDIPITY
dialogue.text: You have your heart set on entering, yes? Then I suppose there is one thing we can try.

dialogue.name: SERENDIPITY
dialogue.text: Let me know when you're ready to get started, and I'll see if we can't get you a nice princess doll.

obj.n: A Peach by Any Other Name
